summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 11872, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Lander Street, from Fourteenth Avenue South to Twentieth Avenue South; Fifteenth Avenue South, from Forest Street to Bay View Street; Sixteenth Avenue South, from Forest Street to Lander Street; Seventeenth Avenue South, from Forest Street to Bay View Street; Eighteenth Avenue South, from Forest Street to Bay View Street; and Nineteenth Avenue South, from Forest Street to Bay View Street, all in the City of Seattle, by constructing therein wooden water mains, together with such gates, tees, crosses, fire hydrants and other appurtenances as may be necessary for the reasonable water service and fire protection of said portions of said streets, in accordance with Resolution No. 218 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 4, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
